resources.string:
This app allows to send/receive files from another device in Peer to Peer (P2P), with mobile's data. P2P means that the data transferred goes directly from one device to another, without any intermediate server.

To be able to transfer files, both devices needs to be connected to the same Wi-Fi, or one device must share its data (hotspot) to the other.

To assure a transfer without problems, please make sure that both devices have the latest version of the app

Fandem is an open-source project. You can consult the source code

\t\t\t\tTo receive files, go to the receive screen, Wait for the app to find the sender peer. Once the sender is found, the transfer can start. You can consult the progress on the notification created.

\t\t\t\tTo send a files, pick one by clicking on the button. Once it is done, a key will be displayed on the screen, you can eventually provide it to the receiving device but the receiver should be able to detect your device without it.\nAfter the receiving peer will have found your device, the transfer will start. All files are downloaded in your \'Download\' folder.\nYou can the see the progress on the notification created
Waiting for the receiving peer. You can provide the following peer key\n\n%s
The file selected couldn\'t be sent
An error occurred during the transfer: %s
The following files were successfully sent %s
The following file(s) were successfully received in your Download folder\n%s
%s was saved in your Download folder
The file couldn\'t be downloaded entirely. You should delete it.
An error occurred during the transfer: %s. The file couldn\'t be downloaded entirely. You should delete it.
Transfer started. You can see the progress in the notification bar
Error: couldn\'t get size of file
Error: couldn\'t get name of file
Couldn\'t get ip address. Please verify your internet connection
Do you want to receive the following file(s)?\n%s
Service was canceled due to timeout. Please try again
In order to receive a file, the app needs to write on your device. Do you want to grant write permission?
Couldn\'t start looking for senders (are you connected to the internet?)
No sending peer were found. Swipe down to retry
Couldn\'t start transfer with other peer
The received file is corrupted, you should delete it and restart the transfer
You can move this file to your phone\'s accessible storage (e.g your Download folder), or delete this file
Are you sure you want to delete %s?
Couldn\'t get files list. Please retry
Warning: source file couldn\'t be deleted
Files will be saved in your \'Download\' folder
You will have to select the location where to save the file
This app allows you to transfer files to another device
The transfer is made in Peer to Peer (P2P), meaning that the data goes from one device, directly to the other. There is no intermediate server in between, allowing you to keep your data private.
Both devices should be connected to the same Wi-Fi. Then they will be able to communicate between them
One device can turn on Wi-Fi hotspot, and have the other device connect to the hotspot. You don\'t need to have a internet or even have SIM card for this to work
In order to transfer files, both devices needs to be connected on the same Wi-Fi, or one device should share its data (hotspot) and have the other connect to that hotspot
You cannot send more than 10 files at once
Transfer will start with peer key %s\n\nConsult your notifications to follow the progress
Without notifications you won\'t be able to follow the progress of the transfer
Error while searching for sending peers
Once you started a transfer, you can follow its progress through your notifications.
